questions.text: An apparently healthy 15-year-old boy dies during a minor surgical procedure while under general anesthesia. The boy’s grandfather has also died during a surgical procedure. A clinical assessment team determines that the child had malignant hyperthermia (MH). MH is an inherited disease in which the triggering agents, such as certain anesthetics, stimulate calcium release from storage sites in muscle, leading to elevated concentration of sarcoplasmic calcium. The MH crisis is most likely to be associated with which of the following?
Which of the following is responsible for elasticity in skeletal muscle?
During a graded activity which of the following is true?

options.label: A
options.text: Fast muscle fibres are recruited before slow muscle fibres

options.label: B
options.text: Large muscle fibres are recruited before small muscle fibres

options.label: C
options.text: Well perfused muscle fibres are recruited before poorly perfused muscle fibres

options.label: D
options.text: Strong muscle fibres are recruited before weak muscle fibres

questions.correct_answer: C. Well perfused muscle fibres are recruited before poorly perfused muscle fibres

questions.text: Resting length corresponds with which of the following sarcomere lengths?
Given below is the myogram of a single muscle twitch. What is the tetanizing frequency?
In a person on a high potassium diet, which part of the nephron would be expected to secrete the most potassium?
Which nephron segment is the primary site of magnesium reabsorption in normal conditions?

options.label: B
options.text: Descending thin segment of loop of henle

options.label: C
options.text: Thick ascending limb of loop of henle

questions.correct_answer: C. Thick ascending limb of loop of henle

questions.text: A 55-year-old male has renovascular hypertension as a result of renal artery stenosis of left kidney. Which of the following is an unlikely finding in this patient?
questions.correct_answer: D. Increased renal afferent arteriolar pressure

questions.text: Which of the following has the highest clearance?
Tubular concentration of which of the following substances will be the highest at the end of PCT?
Which of the following is the correct formula for calculation of ejection fraction?
Which of the following waves of JVP occurs in the isovolumetric contraction phase?
All of the following are true about the mean systemic filling pressure except?

options.label: A
options.text: It is the pressure recorded in blood vessels when the heart stops beating and circulation stops

options.label: B
options.text: It is mainly affected by blood volume and venous tone

options.label: D
options.text: Increase in mean systemic filling pressure decreases venous return

questions.correct_answer: D. Increase in mean systemic filling pressure decreases venous return

questions.text: If ECG, phonocardiogram and carotid pressure changes are being recorded simultaneously, which of the following describes total electromechanical systole?

options.label: A
options.text: From onset of Q to onset of first heart sound

options.label: B
options.text: From onset of Q to onset of second heart sound

options.label: C
options.text: From onset of Q to onset of third heart sound

options.label: D
options.text: From onset of Q to onset of Fourth heart sound

questions.correct_answer: B. From onset of Q to onset of second heart sound

questions.text: What is the duration of the nodal delay?
Which of the following statements are true about amylin? (multiple true statements)

options.label: A
options.text: It is secreted by beta cells of pancreas

options.label: B
options.text: Ratio of insulin and amylin is 100:1

questions.text: Family studies in patients with neonatal diabetes mellitus identified mutation involving a potassium channel expressed in pancreatic beta cells. These patients were successfully treated by sulfonylureas. Which of the following substances binds directly to these potassium channels to regulate their activity?
Match the following
Change in sex hormone binding globulin will most affect levels of which of these hormones?
Shown below are the changes in secretion of T 4 , T 3 , RT 3 following a dietary modification. Which of the following can produce the changes as seen in the diagram?

options.label: D
options.text: diet lacking in essential fatty acids

questions.text: A 50-year-old woman was admitted to the hospital with symptoms of nausea and vomiting for about 2 days followed by severe muscle weakness and neurologic symptoms, including ptosis and dysphagia. She gave a history of having eaten at a restaurant the evening before the symptoms began. Laboratory tests were positive for Clostridium botulinum. The basis for the muscle weakness in this case was most likely because the toxin

options.label: A
options.text: Blocked the reuptake of neurotransmitter into pre-synaptic terminals

options.label: B
options.text: Bound irreversibly to the receptors on the post-synaptic membrane

options.label: C
options.text: Prevented release of acetylcholine from motor neurons

options.label: D
options.text: Reached the cell body of the motor neuron by diffusion into the spinal cord

questions.correct_answer: C. Prevented release of acetylcholine from motor neurons

questions.text: All of the following are sarcolemmal proteins except
Which of the following type of heat is produced only in a muscle contracting isotonically?
Which of the following is associated with mutation of the genes coding for sarcoglycans?
All of the following are features of complete tetanus except?

options.label: A
options.text: There is no relaxation between successive contractions

options.label: B
options.text: There are periods of incomplete relaxation between successive contractions

options.label: C
options.text: Tension developed during a complete tetanus is about four times that developed by individual twitch contractions

options.label: D
options.text: Stimulation frequency at which summation of contractions occurs producing complete tetanus is determined by the contraction period of that particular muscle

questions.correct_answer: B. There are periods of incomplete relaxation between successive contractions

questions.text: Which set of changes would be expected to occur in response to direct increases in renal arterial pressure without an intact tubuloglomerular feedback system?

A patient has a GFR of 100mL/min, urine flow rate of 2mL/min and a plasma glucose concentration of 200mg/dL. If the TmG (transport maxima for Glucose) is 250mg/min, what would be this patient’s rate of glucose excretion?
At which site in the nephron will the concentration of creatinine be the highest in a normally hydrated person?
Given below are the renal clearance curves for different substances If C is renal learance of Inulin, curve D corresponds to renal clearance of which of the following substances?
Which of the following substances has the highest TF/P ratios at the end of the PCT?
Growth hormoneShown below is the response of a hormone to a meal and insulin-induced hypoglycemia. The hormone is most likely to be which of the following?
Which of the following shows a pattern of secretion as depicted in the adjacent diagram?
Which of the following hormones will show the following change with age?

A 65- year-old man presented with progressive leg weakness and a diagnosis of LEMS (Lambert- Eaton myasthenic syndrome) was made by serial repetitive nerve stimulation test. Which of the following channels are affected in Lamber-Eaton syndrome?

options.label: A
options.text: Voltage- gated calcium channels on pre- synaptic membrane

options.label: B
options.text: Voltage- gated calcium channels on post- synaptic membrane

options.label: C
options.text: Ligand- gated sodium channels on pre- synaptic membrane

options.label: D
options.text: Ligand- gated sodium channels on post- synaptic membrane

questions.correct_answer: A. Voltage- gated calcium channels on pre- synaptic membrane

questions.text: Which of the following best describes a motor unit?

options.label: A
options.text: Single A? motor neuron and all the muscle fibres it supplies

options.label: B
options.text: Single muscle fibre and all the A? motor neurons supplying it

options.label: C
options.text: Single sensory neuron and all the muscle fibres it supplies

options.label: D
options.text: Single muscle fibre and all the sensory neurons supplying it

questions.correct_answer: A. Single A? motor neuron and all the muscle fibres it supplies

questions.text: Given below is a graph of the length-tension relationship. Which of the following are true regarding optimum length? (multiple correct options).

options.label: A
options.text: Optimum length corresponds to a sarcomere length of 2- 2.2 microns

options.label: B
options.text: There are maximum number of actin- myosin cross bridges at optimum length

options.label: C
options.text: There is minimum overlap between actin and myosin

options.label: D
options.text: Optimum length is also known as the resting length

options.label: E
options.text: At optimum length, active and passive tension are maximum.

questions.text: Each molecule of troponin C can bind how many calcium ions?
Acetylcholine receptors on the motor end plate are which of the following?

options.label: B
options.text: Voltage gated sodium and potassium channels

options.label: D
options.text: Ligand gated sodium and potassium channels

questions.correct_answer: D. Ligand gated sodium and potassium channels

questions.text: Which of the following is the most important controller of coronary blood flow?
Which of the following is known as the “gatekeeper” of the heart?
Phospholamban in cardiac and smooth muscle cells in which of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: Excitatory protein which increases SERCA activity

options.label: B
options.text: Inhibitory protein which decreases SERCA activity

options.label: C
options.text: Excitatory protein which increases Na+-Ca++ antiport

options.label: D
options.text: Inhibitory protein which decreases Na+-Ca++ antiport

questions.correct_answer: B. Inhibitory protein which decreases SERCA activity

questions.text: All of the following are true about angiotensin II except?

options.label: C
options.text: Acts on SFO and OVLT to cause a dipsogenic effect

options.label: D
options.text: Acts on area postrema and increases the sensitivity of the baroreceptor reflex

questions.correct_answer: D. Acts on area postrema and increases the sensitivity of the baroreceptor reflex

questions.text: Unlike the systemic circulation, pulmonary circulation is a:
Which of the following is the correct sequence of events in skeletal muscle?

options.label: A
options.text: Muscle action potential, muscle contraction, nerve action potential

options.label: B
options.text: Nerve action potential, muscle contraction, muscle action potential

options.label: C
options.text: Muscle contraction, nerve action potential, muscle action potential

options.label: D
options.text: Nerve action potential, muscle action potential, muscle contraction

questions.correct_answer: D. Nerve action potential, muscle action potential, muscle contraction

questions.text: Shown below is an electron microscopic picture of a sarcomere. Which of the following represent the H-zone?
Which of the following is greater in afterloaded muscle contractions as compared to preloaded muscle contractions?

A 55-year-old woman visits her physician because of double vision, drooping of eyelids, difficulty in chewing and swallowing, and general weakness in her limbs. All these symptoms worsen with exercise and occur more frequently late in the day. The physician suspects myasthenia gravis and orders a Tensilon test. The test is positive. What is the most likely basis for the symptoms described in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Depletion of voltage-gated calcium channels in certain motor neurons

options.label: B
options.text: Development of macro motor units after recovery from poliomyelitis

options.label: C
options.text: Over exertion resulting in junction fatigue

questions.text: 60% of the total body water in is which of the following compartments?
Which of the following are best suited to measure the intracellular fluid volume?

A 70-year old man has congestive cardiac failure. His cardiac output is 4L/min, bp is 110/80 mm Hg and heart rate is 90/minute. Further tests reveal that his right atrial pressure is 10 mm Hg. Which of the following will be expected to increase in this patient?
The equation which is used to calculate the magnitude of the equilibrium potential of a freely diffusible ion is which of the following?
Gibbs- Donnan equilibrium is based on which of the following?

A 18- year old football player sustained a left tibial fracture. The left lower leg was placed in a cast for 8 weeks. After the cast was removed the left gastrocnemius muscle was found to be significantly smaller in circumference than the right. What is the most likely explanation?

options.label: A
options.text: Decrease in the number of individual muscle fibres in the left gastrocnemius

options.label: B
options.text: Decrease in blood flow to the muscle caused by constriction from the cast

options.label: C
options.text: Temporary reduction in actin and myosin protein synthesis

options.label: D
options.text: Increase in glycolytic activity in the affected muscle

questions.correct_answer: C. Temporary reduction in actin and myosin protein synthesis

questions.text: An ECG showing two P waves preceding each QRS complex. Interpretation of this pattern is:-

options.label: C
options.text: Decreased firing rate of SA node

options.label: D
options.text: Increased firing rate of SA nodes

questions.correct_answer: A. Decreased conduction through AV node.

questions.text: Calculate the total peripheral resistance of an individual from the following measured variables: Mean arterial pressure = 100mm Hg Central venous pressure = 0 mm Hg Cardiac output = 5 L/min What is the total peripheral resistance in Wood Units (mm Hg/L/min), is:
Which of the following is the correct sequence of events in the cardiac cycle?

options.label: A
options.text: a wave of JVP, first heart sound, c wave of JVP, second heart sound

options.label: B
options.text: c wave of JVP, first heart sound, a wave of JVP, second heart sound

options.label: C
options.text: First heart sound, c wave of JVP, second heart sound, a wave of JVP

options.label: D
options.text: First heart sound, a wave of JVP, c wave of JVP, second heart sound

questions.correct_answer: A. a wave of JVP, first heart sound, c wave of JVP, second heart sound

questions.text: Which of the following methods is used to measure the cardiac output?
Baroreceptor is which type of feedback?
Which of the following decreases in length during a muscle contraction?
Motor end plate potential at neuro- muscular junctions is mainly due to which of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: Sodium influx through voltage-gated sodium channels

options.label: B
options.text: Sodium influx through ligand-gated sodium channels

options.label: C
options.text: Potassium efflux through voltage-gated potassium channels

options.label: D
options.text: Potassium efflux through ligand-gated potassium channels

questions.correct_answer: B. Sodium influx through ligand-gated sodium channels

questions.text: Which of the following statements comparing fast-twitch and slow-twitch muscle fibres is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Fast-twitch muscle fibres are more dependent on the phosphagen and glycogen- lactic acid systems

options.label: B
options.text: Fast-twitch muscle fibres have more myoglobin

options.label: C
options.text: Fewer capillaries surround slow-twitch muscle fibres

options.label: D
options.text: Fast twitch muscle fibres are smaller in diameter

questions.correct_answer: A. Fast-twitch muscle fibres are more dependent on the phosphagen and glycogen- lactic acid systems

questions.text: Most of the energy for strenuous exercise that lasts for more than 5- 10 seconds but less than 1 to 2 minutes comes from which of the following?

The following events occur at an excitatory synapse. a. Ligand- gated channels open in the post synaptic membrane to allow influx of sodium b. Synaptic vesicles bind to pre-synaptic membrane c. Depolarization of pre-synaptic membrane d. Opening of calcium channels cause influx of calcium Which of the following is the correct sequence?
If alveolar surface area is decreased by 50% and pulmonary fibrosis leads to doubling of diffusion distance, how will the diffusion of O2 be affected?
Which of the following has similar values for both ICF and ISF?
Hypertonic 3% saline contains how much of Na+ in meq/l?
Simple diffusion and facilitated diffusion share which of the following characteristics?

options.label: D
options.text: Can be blocked by specific transporters

questions.text: Most important buffer in the interstitial fluid is
During exercise in physiological limits what is the effect on end systolic volume?

options.label: D
options.text: ESV first decreases and then increases

questions.text: Which of the following is responsible for BezoldJarish Reflex?

The circuit shown below has an inflow pressure of 120 mm Hg and an outflow pressure of 40 mm Hg. Resistance in each of the four vessels is 2 mm Hg/mL/min. What is the total peripheral resistance of the circuit?
Which statement is incorrect?

options.label: A
options.text: The term “homeostasis” describes the maintenance of nearly constant conditions in the body

options.label: B
options.text: Disease is generally considered to be a state of disrupted homeostasis

options.label: C
options.text: Body’s compensatory mechanisms often lead to small deviations from the normal range in some of the body’s functions

options.label: D
options.text: In most diseases, homeostatic mechanisms are no longer operating

questions.correct_answer: D. In most diseases, homeostatic mechanisms are no longer operating

questions.text: Excess blood is transfused into a patient whose mean arterial pressure increases from 100 to 125 mm Hg. After correction, the patient’s blood pressure is 105 mm Hg. What is the “gain”?
Which statement about feedback control systems is incorrect?

options.label: A
options.text: Most control systems in the body act by negative feedback

options.label: C
options.text: Generation of nerve action potentials involves positive feedback

options.label: D
options.text: Feed- forward is important in regulating motor activity

questions.correct_answer: B. Positive feedback systems are stabilizing

questions.text: All of the following for tight junctions except
All of the following are true about gap junctions except

options.label: A
options.text: Gap junctions form a cytoplasmic “tunnel” for diffusion of small molecules (<1000 Da) between two neighbouring cells

options.label: B
options.text: Gap junctions are formed by proteins called connexons

options.label: C
options.text: Connexons in the membrane of one cell are lined up with connexons of a neighbouring cell to form dodecameric gap junctions

questions.correct_answer: D. Gap junctions form chemical synapses

questions.text: Which changes would you expect to find after administration of a vasodilator drug that caused a 50% decrease in afferent arteriolar resistance and no change in arterial pressure?

options.label: A
options.text: Decreased renal blood flow, decreased glomerular capillary hydrostatic pressure

options.label: B
options.text: Increased renal blood flow, increased glomerular capillary hydrostatic pressure

options.label: C
options.text: Decreased renal blood flow, increased glomerular capillary hydrostatic pressure

options.label: D
options.text: Increased renal blood flow, decreased glomerular capillary hydrostatic pressure

questions.correct_answer: B. Increased renal blood flow, increased glomerular capillary hydrostatic pressure

questions.text: The GFR of a 50-year-old man decreases by 50% and remains at that level. Plasma concentration of which of the following substances will be increased to the greatest extent?
The graph given below depicts filterability of dextran through the kidney, 1 representing complete filtration and 0 representing no filtration. Which of the following are A, B and C respectively?
Which of the following will occur in a dehydrated person deprived of water for more than 24 hours?

options.label: D
options.text: Increased water permeability in the collecting ducts

questions.correct_answer: D. Increased water permeability in the collecting ducts

questions.text: Which of the following is true about the tubular fluid that passes through the lumen of the early distal tubule in the region of the macula densa?
All of the following are present on the alpha subunit of the sodium potassium ATPase pump except?
Which of the following is true about endocytosis?

options.label: A
options.text: Includes phagocytosis and pinocytosis, but not clathrin- mediated or caveolae dependent uptake of extracellular contents

options.label: B
options.text: Refers to merging of an intracellular vesicle with the plasma membrane to deliver vesicular contents to the ECF

options.label: C
options.text: Refers to the invagination of the cell membrane to uptake extracellular contents into the cell

options.label: D
options.text: Refers vesicular trafficking between golgi apparatus

questions.correct_answer: C. Refers to the invagination of the cell membrane to uptake extracellular contents into the cell

questions.text: Sodium iodide symporter is present in all of the following except

Which of the following ions is higher in the ICF?

If the average hydrostatic pressure in the glomerular capillaries is 50 mm Hg, the hydrostatic pressure in the Bowman’s space is 12 mm Hg, the average colloid osmotic pressure in the glomerular capillaries is 30 mm Hg, and there is no protein in the glomerular ultrafiltrate, what is the net pressure driving glomerular filtration?

The maximum clearance rate possible for a substance that is totally cleared from the plasma is equal to which of the following?

options.label: C
options.text: Urinary excretion rate of that substance

questions.text: Membrane potential changes in an isolated cardiac muscle cell are recorded with ion movement across the cell membrane. Which of the following ion sequences corresponds to regions 1-2-3 on the graph respectively?
If an artery is partially occluded by an embolus such that its radius becomes one- half the preocclusion value, which of the following parameters will decrease by a factor of 16?
Which of the following is used to measure the cerebral blood flow?
Which of the following describes infinite feedback gain principle?

options.label: A
options.text: Negative feedback system with error of zero

options.label: B
options.text: Negative feedback system with correction of zero

options.label: C
options.text: Negative feedback system with gain of zero

options.label: D
options.text: There is no such thing as infinite gain in a feedback system

questions.correct_answer: A. Negative feedback system with error of zero

questions.text: All of the following are true about the safety factor against edema except

options.label: A
options.text: Safety factor due to low tissue compliance in the negative pressure range is 3 mm Hg

options.label: B
options.text: Safety factor due to increased lymph flow is 7 mm Hg

options.label: C
options.text: Safety factor due to washout of proteins from the interstitial spaces is 7 mm Hg

options.label: D
options.text: Total safety factor of 17 mm Hg implies that the edema results when the capillary hydrostatic pressure is 17 mm Hg

questions.correct_answer: D. Total safety factor of 17 mm Hg implies that the edema results when the capillary hydrostatic pressure is 17 mm Hg

The RMP of a cell is -70mV. The equilibrium potentials for important ions under normal physiologic conditions are as follows:- ECa = +125mV ENa = +60mv EMg = 0mV ECl = -70mV EK = -90mV If physiologic conditions are maintained which of the following is likely to flow out of the cells after opening their respective ion channels.
With regard to the control of minute ventilation by carbon dioxide

options.label: A
options.text: About 70% of the effect of PaO2 is mediated by the peripheral chemoreceptors

options.label: B
options.text: Central effects are mediated by direct effects on cells of the DRG/VRG complex

options.label: C
options.text: Sensitivity of the control system is inversely related to the prevailing PaO2

options.label: D
options.text: This mechanism is less sensitive than control in response to oxygen

questions.correct_answer: C. Sensitivity of the control system is inversely related to the prevailing PaO2

questions.text: Match the following receptors with the reflexes.

Given below are four statements regarding airway resistance of which one or more may be correct. Choose the correct option using the following key. 1. Airway resistance is low in large as well as in small diameter airways 2. Airway resistance is highest in medium sized airways 3. Medium sized airways have a turbulent airflow which increases the resistance to airflow 4. Density of the gas can also affect airway resistance
For the two scenarios given below choose the appropriate answer from the Answer Option list given below:-

A person’s normal tidal volume is 400mL with a dead space of 100mL. his respiratory rate is 12 per minute. The person undergoes ventilation during surgery, and the tidal volume is 700mL with a rate of 12 per minute. What is the approximate alveolar Pco2 for this person?

Given below are four statements regarding the blood-brain barrier of which one or more may be correct. Choose the correct answer using the following key:- 1. Blood-brain barrier is formed by the tight junctions between the ependymal cells forming the ventricular walls 2. Blood-brain barrier is formed by the tight junctions between adjacent endothelial cells of the choroid plexus 3. Blood-brain barrier is formed by the tight junctions between adjacent cells of the choroid plexus 4. Astrocytes induce the formation of tight junctions between the endothelial cells

Assertion- For male differentiation to occur during embryonic development, testosterone must be secreted from the testes. Reason- HCG binds to LH receptors on the interstitial cells of the testes of the male foetus, resulting in the production of testosterone, which causes the foetus to develop male sex organs instead of female sex organs. Choose the appropriate answer using the following key.

options.label: A
options.text: Both assertion and reason are independently correct and reason is the correct explanation for the assertion.

options.label: B
options.text: Both assertion and reason are independently correct but the reason is not the correct explanation for the assertion.

options.label: C
options.text: Assertion is independently correct and reason is independently is incorrect.

options.label: D
options.text: Assertion is independently incorrect and reason is independently correct.

options.label: E
options.text: Both assertion and reason are independently incorrect.

questions.correct_answer: A. Both assertion and reason are independently correct and reason is the correct explanation for the assertion.

questions.text: For the two scenarios given below choose the appropriate answer from the Answer Option list given below:-

In an animal experiment the levels of various endogenous compounds are measured in the spinal fluid after application of painful stimuli. One of the compounds that increases because of this experiment is a pentapeptide with a high affinity for delta and mu-receptors. Which of the following substance is most likely to have a common molecular origin with the pentapeptide described above?

A patient is being evaluated for hypoventilation. He is asked to take several deep breaths in rapid succession, and the following information is obtained: Which of the following is the most likely site of this patient’s disease?

A 65-year-old man with type 2 diabetes mellitus comes to the physician for a routine check-up. He was on OHAs for the last 12 years but was recently switched to a long-acting insulin due to inadequate blood sugar control. His last serum creatinine was 2.1 mg/dL. The patient’s son, who is a dental student, is concerned about his father’s elevated creatinine level and how it relates his kidney function. Which of the following graphs accurately represents the relationship between GFR and serum creatinine levels?

options.label: A
options.text: Stimulation of parasympathetic nerves to airways

options.label: C
options.text: Release of histamine by mast cells

questions.text: Which point in the figure given below corresponds with arterial blood in a severely anemic patient?

options.label: D
options.text: at the end of tidal respiration

Myocardial tension increases with increase in heart rate. This is k/a

A 65-year-old avid male hiker, resident of Manali (at 5000 ft) was hiking in Sikkim with two companions. They hiked to Nathula in Sikkim at 12,000 ft in one day. He suddenly complained of extreme tiredness, light headedness, dizziness, difficulty in breathing. He began coughing and complained of tightness in the chest. He was taken to the emergency of a local hospital. Examination revealed respiratory rate of 32 per min, heart rate of 125/min, bp 180/100 mm Hg, bluish discoloration of fingertips, crackles and wheeze on the right lower lobe. His X-ray chest was done and is shown:- Which of the following is not a possible reason for the man’s condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Hypoxia induced vasoconstriction of pulmonary capillaries

options.label: B
options.text: Increased pressure in the pulmonary capillary beds

options.label: C
options.text: Disruption of the endothelial barrier resulting in leakage of fluid and proteins into the alveoli

options.label: D
options.text: Hypoxia causing vasodilation of pulmonary capillaries resulting in increased fluid formation

questions.correct_answer: D. Hypoxia causing vasodilation of pulmonary capillaries resulting in increased fluid formation

Which of the following has an intranuclear receptor?
All of the following increase appetite except?
Which of the following is not seen in hyperbaric oxygen therapy?
Which part of the body is represented superiorly and medially in the post central gyrus?
Which of the following tends to decrease airway resistance?
Which of the following will cause a decrease in plasma potassium levels by causing a shift in potassium from ECF to ICF?
Which of the following water-soluble hormones does not need a second messenger?
Changes in which of the following does not affect respiration?
PO 2 of 8kPa corresponds with Hb saturation of

The following events occur in the carotid bodies on exposure to hypoxia are listed in random order: (1) release of dopamine (2) excitation of afferent fibres of ninth nerve (3) depolarization of glomus cells (4) decreased potassium conductance through O2 sensitive potassium channels on glomus cells (5) opening of voltage gated calcium channels and calcium influx What is the correct sequence in which the above occur on exposure to hypoxia?
Which of the following is not seen during acclimatization to high altitude?

options.label: B
options.text: Shift of OHDC to the right

options.label: D
options.text: Decrease in the number of mitochondria

questions.correct_answer: D. Decrease in the number of mitochondria

questions.text: Migrating motor complex is triggered by which of the following?
Which of the following will cause the OHDC to shift to the left?
A 20-year-old medical student is asked to recount his fifth birthday celebrations which he is able to describe vividly. This type of memory recall is which of the following?
Maximum CO2 transport in venous blood occurs as which of the following?
Which spinal cord level contains the entire population of pre-ganglionic sympathetic neurons?
Which of the following is likely to produce an increase in cerebral blood flow?

options.label: D
options.text: Decrease in bp from 120 mm Hg to 90 mm Hg

questions.text: Which of the following best describes the functional role of the lateral hemispheres of the cerebellum?

options.label: A
options.text: Control and co-ordinate movements of the axial muscles, as well as the shoulder and hip

options.label: B
options.text: Control and co-ordinate movements of the distal limb muscles

options.label: C
options.text: Function with the cerebral cortex to plan motor movements

options.label: D
options.text: Maintain balance and co-ordinate eye movements

questions.correct_answer: C. Function with the cerebral cortex to plan motor movements

questions.text: Lesion of which of the following areas of the brain would have the most devastating effect on verbal and symbolic intelligence?

options.label: A
options.text: Wernicke’s area on the nondominant side of the brain

options.label: B
options.text: Wernicke’s area on the dominant side of the brain

options.label: C
options.text: Broca’s area on the nondominant side of the brain

options.label: D
options.text: Broca’s area on the dominant side of the brain

questions.correct_answer: B. Wernicke’s area on the dominant side of the brain

questions.text: Which of the following stimulator- mediator pair inhibits gastrin secretion?
Which anterior pituitary hormone plays a major role in the regulation of a nonendocrine target gland?
At birth, a large, well-nourished baby is found to have a plasma glucose of 17mg/dL and a plasma insulin concentration twice the normal value. What is the explanation for these findings?

options.label: A
options.text: The neonate experienced malnutrition in utero

options.label: B
options.text: The mother was malnourished during her pregnancy

options.label: C
options.text: The mother is diabetic, with poorly controlled hyperglycemia

questions.correct_answer: C. The mother is diabetic, with poorly controlled hyperglycemia

questions.text: Cortisone is administered to a 30-year-old woman for the treatment of an auto-immune disease. Which of the following is most likely to occur in this patient?
The function of which of the following is increased by an elevated parathormone concentration?

options.label: C
options.text: Phosphate reabsorptive pathways in the renal tubules

questions.text: A 37-year-old woman presents to her physician with an enlarged thyroid gland and high plasma levels of T4 and T3. Which of the following is likely to be decreased?
Which structure serves as an “alternate pathway” for signals from the motor cortex?
When compared with late evening values typically observed in normal subjects, plasma levels of both ACTH and cortisol would be expected to be higher in which persons?

options.label: A
options.text: Normal subjects after waking in the morning

options.label: B
options.text: Normal subjects who have taken dexamethasone

questions.correct_answer: A. Normal subjects after waking in the morning

questions.text: A 59-year-old woman has osteoporosis, hypertension, hirsuitism, and hyperpigmentation. Magnetic resonance imaging indicates that the pituitary gland is not enlarged. Which condition is most consistent with these findings?

options.label: C
options.text: Inappropriately high secretion rate of ACTH

questions.text: A man who has been exposed to high levels of gamma radiation is sterile due to destruction of the germinal epithelium of the seminiferous tubules, although he has normal levels of testosterone. Which of the following would be found in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: A normal secretory pattern of GnRH

questions.correct_answer: A. A normal secretory pattern of GnRH

questions.text: A 45-year-old woman has a mass in the sellatursica that compresses the portal vessels, disrupting pituitary access to hypothalamic secretions. The secretion rate of which of the following hormones would most likely increase in this patient?
A heroin addict has chronically increased levels of TBG. This would result in which of the following in this individual?
questions.correct_answer: D. No change in metabolic rate

questions.text: A 55-year-old man has developed the SIADH due to carcinoma of the lung. Which of the following physiological response will be seen in this patient?

options.label: D
options.text: Increased ADH secretion from the pituitary

questions.correct_answer: D. Increased ADH secretion from the pituitary

questions.text: A 46-year-old woman has “puffy” skin and is lethargic. Her plasma TSH concentration is low and increases markedly when given TRH. What is the most likely diagnosis?

options.label: A
options.text: Hyperthyroidism due to an abnormality in the pituitary

options.label: B
options.text: Hyperthyroidism due to an abnormality in the hypothalamus

options.label: C
options.text: Hypothyroidism due to abnormality in the pituitary

options.label: D
options.text: Hypothyroidism due to abnormality in the hypothalamus

questions.correct_answer: D. Hypothyroidism due to abnormality in the hypothalamus

questions.text: Which manoeuvre will attenuate the stretch reflex in skeletal muscles?

options.label: A
options.text: Sectioning of the dorsal root of a spinal nerve

options.label: D
options.text: Sectioning of the medial leminiscus on the contralateral side

questions.correct_answer: A. Sectioning of the dorsal root of a spinal nerve

questions.text: Some cells secrete chemicals into the ECF that act on cells in the same tissue. Which of the following refers to this type of regulation?

A young woman is given daily injections of a substance beginning on the 16th day of her normal menstrual cycle and continuing for 3 weeks. As long as the injections continue, she does not menstruate. The injected substance could be which of the following?
Which of the following will cause a decrease in metabolic rate?

In a patient with type 1 diabetes who is not receiving insulin and who has a fasting blood glucose of 400mg/ dL, what would the respiratory quotient likely be 2 hours after eating a light meal containing 60% carbohydrates, 20% proteins, and 20% fats?
Which of the following substances causes relaxation of the LES and fundus of the stomach during swallowing?

The spinal cord of a 60-year-old woman is severed in an automobile accident. She devises a method to distend the rectum to initiate the rectosphincteric reflex. Rectal distension DOES NOT cause which of the following responses in this woman?

options.label: B
options.text: Contraction of descending and sigmoid colon

questions.correct_answer: C. Contraction of external anal sphincter

questions.text: The lieum and distal jejunum of a 25-year-old man are ruptured in a road traffic accident. The entire ileum and a portion of the distal jejunum are resected. What is most likely in this patient?

A 45-year old man inspired as much air as possible and then expired with maximum effort until no more air could be expired. The flow rate during expiration were recorded as the flow- volume curve given below. What is the PEFR in this man (in L/min)?
Which of the following substance added to the perfusate of an isolated rabbit’s heart causes the heart to stop in systole?
Which of the following transmitters is secreted by axons of the locus ceruleus that distribute throughout much of the brain?
Sweat glands and piloerector muscles of hairy skin are innervated by which type of fibres?
Cells of the adrenal medulla receive synaptic input from which of the following neurons?
In a muscle spindle, which of the following is responsible for the dynamic response?
Which of the following correctly describes the relationship of the CSF pressure to the venous pressure in the superior sagittal sinus?
In a neurophysiological experiment conducted with monkeys, the amygdalae were surgically ablated bilaterally. Which of the following is most likely increased 6 months after ablation of the amygdalae?
Which of the following sensory receptors is responsible for a bisynaptic reflex?
Position sense involves muscle spindles and which of the following receptors?

options.label: C
options.text: Both tactile and joint capsule receptors

questions.correct_answer: C. Both tactile and joint capsule receptors

questions.text: For a sensory nerve fibre that is connected to the Meissner’s corpuscles located on the fingertips of the right hand, the synapse with the second order neuron in the corresponding sensory pathway is in which of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: Right dorsal horn of spinal cord at the level of entry

options.label: B
options.text: Left dorsal horn of spinal cord at level of entry

questions.text: Interneurons that utilize enkephalin to inhibit afferent pain signals are most likely to be found in which region of the central nervous system?

options.label: A
options.text: Dorsal horn of the spinal cord

options.label: B
options.text: Ventral horn of the spinal cord

questions.correct_answer: A. Dorsal horn of the spinal cord

questions.text: An input neuron to a diverging circuit causes the membrane potential to change from -65mV to -55mV. Which of the following best describes this change in potential?

A 20-year-old man has a road traffic accident that completely eliminates all nerve traffic in the right half of his spinal cord at C2. Loss of which of the following is likely in the left hand of this patient?

A 75-year-old man presents to the emergency with severe headache and weakness and tingling in the left arm. There are no other symptoms. His arterial pressure of 180/100 mm Hg and a cardiac output (determined by echocardiography) of 4.0 L/min. His heart rate is 90 beats per minute. A decreased production of which of the following would most likely result in hypertension?
